resources.string: Use this to configure your battery to setup for learn mode. Writing each parameter writes to the corresponding register stored in the battery EEPROM chip.

Technical help is available at XDA via the link below.
 
 Need to add link.

This battery app interacts directly with the chip inside the DS2784 battery. Each parameter seen in this app is pulled from the corresponding register location inside the EEPROM memory. This app allows both read and write to any of these registers giving the user full control over their battery's parameters.
 
In order for this app to function it must be used on a custom ROM with an edited ds2784_battery.c driver, which is most commonly available on Cyanogenmod 6.1 and pershoot's kernel for the Nexus One.
 
The driver edits to the Nexus battery driver are available thanks to:

theloginwithnoname @XDA and 
RogerPodacter @XDA.

The status register is a 1 byte/8 bit address. Each bit can be 1 or 0, on or off, with descritions below:
 
1001 1010

[CHGTF][AEF][SEF][LEARNF] [X][UVF][PORF][X]

 CHGTF - Charge Termination Flag
 AEF - Active-Empty Flag
 SEF - Standby-Empty Flag
 LEARNF - Learn Flag
 X - Not Used
 UVF - Under-Volt Flag
 PORF - Power-On Reset Flag
 X - Not Used
mV to activate learn mode.\n\nWhen the learn flag in the status register turns on, plug in the charger immediately.
-To re-calibrate your battery, turn on learn detect below and then drain your battery.
-Learn cycle is in progress. The calibration will be complete by charging to full uninterrupted. At that point the CHGTF will be set and the battery\'s age will be updated with the new learned value.
-CHGTF is set, battery is fully charged.
PLUG IN NOW!! The learn flag is on!
During learn detect this option allows the GPS to be polled to increase battery drain
Screen will stay on during learn detect mode.

During learn detect this option allows the ACR to be periodically adjusted to ensure mAh capacity does not run out.
